item.title: The Roman Conquest of Britain
item.description: Julius Caesar was the first Roman emperor to conquer Britain, although only nominally in 55 B.C.. The main reasons were two: Britain had a good soil to farm. Celts were helping Gauls, and they had to be taught a lesson He didn’t tryhard and did this just to scare the Celts from helping Gauls, so he failed and lost. Emperor Claudius, about ~90 years later, in 43 A.D., took control of central and south eastern Britain.
